net.explorviz.shared.security.filters

Annotation Type Secure


  • @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @NameBinding
public @interface Secure
    You can annotate a resource with @Secure to instruct that inbound requests are first passed to the AuthenticationFilter and AuthorizationFilter. Thus, you should specify one of RolesAllowed, DenyAll, and PermitAll at the same method. If none is given, the request is denied by default. The latter annotations have no effects if @Secure is not used.

    If a resource class is annotated, the above explained applies to all contained resource methods.

    You need to make sure that AuthenticationFilter and AuthorizationFilter are registered in this order at the application.
